noun.description: A claim or assertion of a claim to something.
examples: we cannot tolerate pretension to infallibility

noun.description: The use of affectation to impress; ostentatiousness.

verb.description: Apply tension to (an object) during manufacture or prior to some other process.
examples: the safety system pretensions the seat belts

origin: Late Middle English: from medieval Latin praetensio(n-), from praetens- alleged, from the verb praetendere (see pretend).
